page.title: 01Introduction.
page.content: The area in our block is the land south of the A69 and the western part of the town of{Haltwhistle. }After the railway station was built in 1838, the old town around the Church and Market Place grew towards the station. As Haltwhistle grew in size as a{coal {mining}town (there is now only one small mine) terraced houses were built in the west end of Haltwhistle. The{Newcastle-Carlisle railway line and the{A69}run parallel to the{South {Tyne}River, and there is some factory development in this area. South of the river is farmland, cultivated grass-land in the valley bottom, rough grazing, fell and some woodland. Most of the farms concentrate on stock raising. There are also two villages - {Park Village and Plenmeller. }The topics described have some connection with the children in out school.
